website_summaries.verdict: If your dog likes fish or you've been advised that a fish-based diet is best, this is a good choice.
pros: Provides a grain-free, limited ingredient recipe made with fish – a top protein choice for dogs with food allergies
cons: The kibble has a strong odor, and some dog owners noted that their dogs began emitting an odor after eating it
Some dogs weren't fond of it

customer_reviews.title: FOUND LARVAE IN DOG FOOD
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely angry 😡!!! My dog’s food states that doesn’t expire until July 2018! I opened up his dry food today and found larvae growing in his food! I keep his bag of food sealed shut. LARVAE WAS GROWING INSIDE HIS FOOD THAT HE EATS EVERYDAY! Natural balance is suppose to be a good product! I am never buying from this company again!!! I can’t beliebe my poor frenchie has been eating this!!!!! WTF?!? I demand a refund. Totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: MOLD in dry food kibble.  Check the entire bag before feeding to your dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Check ALL of the food inside the bag before feeding to your dog. MOLDY food. Inconsistent since some bags are ok and others are not. NB customer service and Amazon are aware. Both have issued refunds where appropriate. NB checks each batch before it leaves the plant. So, that is comforting BUT somewhere between them and my house, the food gets MOLDY. So, if you feed this food, check each bag thoroughly. This has happened now and again for us so, we are moving to a different brand. My dogs did not get sick but this is not their total diet and the dogs are large breed.
customer_reviews.author: javaxf2222

customer_reviews.title: Use with Caution!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this dry dog food for years, & our dogs did very well with it! Something in the formula or ingredients has recently changed. Both of our dogs became very sick with stomach related problems. Thanks to antibiotics & chicken/ rice bland diet for several weeks, they are better now. Never again will we use Natural Balance in our household!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: AGAIN...WHAT AM I FEEDING MY DOG!!!! WHAT FOOD AM DO I KEEP RECEIVING?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I have just received today for my dog, second bag, second month on this dog food; sweet potato and bison. I don't know which order is the real deal? Why? First bag compared to the new bag of the same food, look completely different. So my question is, what am I feeding my dog? Which bag is real? Can someone send me the real dog food, natural balance, sweet potato and bison? I will send pictures along so I can get some answers please?! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: QDee

customer_reviews.title: Price jump!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this food for a few years and the price has been around $60 for the 26lb bag. This month it jumped to $71. Could be a ploy to get more people to subscribe, but I am not biting. My dog does not go through a whole bag in a month. And two months is too long. Feel free to @ me but I am switching to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Will make you dog ill.
customer_reviews.text: Please not only read this review, but the many others on Consumeraffairs.com. Apparently Natural Balance has recently changed their formula and sourcing for their dog food. Both my dogs be came ill from eating Natural Balance, vomiting, diarrhea, lots of bile, and they became lethargic. This change has been in the last month. My dog bounced back quickly after being taken off of this food. Please do yourself and your dog a favor is skip over this dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: My 70 lb Labradoodle had constant ear infections requiring daily ...
customer_reviews.text: My 70 lb Labradoodle had constant ear infections requiring daily treatment and vet supervision. I tried a holistic vet who suggested a limited ingredient dog food without chicken. After about a month, he had no more ear infections, no special maintenance ear washes. No ear issues! Have used venison and fish varieties of Natural Balance and now trying beef. Venison was our fav or 5 years but cost has gone up beyond our budget. He only gets 2 cups per day and minimal treats (Natural Balance Limited ingredient of course) and he has maintained a health weight for his size. Even his poop is prize worthy. Per past experience. I think Natural Balance Limited Ingredient dog food is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: Have been feeding my dog this for the past 3 years. The last bag I received with an expiration date of 11/7/19 made my dog ill. Diaherra, Lethargic and basically I’ll. Spoke with the company that manufacturers this. It looks different in color and shape. They claim yes the product batch report showed it was different in color and shape but that’s it. My vet thinks that either it was mis packaged or there is something wrong. This batch needs to be tested! Beware and watch for any signs of illness. She was fine prior to eating from this newly opened bag and batch.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Worth every pretty penny
customer_reviews.text: We were recommended this dog food at the pet store because my dog has a sensitive stomach. He survived parvo as a puppy and was left with bloody poops and yellow throwing up everywhere for years after. I finally had had enough when our daughter was 2 and I was pregnant and couldn't clean up after him all of the time. They recommended we switch to this because the duck is closer to a natural diet and the yams are sensitive on their stomach. He seriously hasn't had another throw up or bloody poop in 4 years! I swear by it. Worth every pretty penny!
customer_reviews.author: Bsmom

customer_reviews.title: price keeps going up and up and up!
customer_reviews.text: I have no choice but I have to change my dog's food. He had allergy issues so we switched to this food 4 or 5 years ago. He did much better when on this food and I think a large part of the solution was the protein in it... At the time, when I switched, a 26 lb bag was around $51-$53.... Now it's $71!? Price just keeps going up. I can't afford to keep buying this food. I'm hopping off the bandwagon. This is my final purchase (because my dog is out). Time to see what the other options are. Time to start mixing and getting him off this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: My girls love this food.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Great Pyrenees that had many allergies. I switched him to this and he did very well. We lost him to bone cancer a couple of years ago and I continued to use this to feed my 3 Yorkies. They are very health and happy, no digestive problems at all. My oldest is 10 yrs old and the puppies are 3 yrs old. I just signed up last week for the subscription to receive a bag every 2 months. Sometimes our local pet store has it and sometimes they are out. Now I will have it delivered to my door without delay. I actually just received my first one via delivery yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Fake product?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this food for the past year. My pit has a ton of allergies and at first this helped. After bulk placing an order for 4 big bags, I noticed different packaging and the food was a different color. I didn’t think it’d be an issue till his allergy symptoms returned on the bag with the most variances. His skin turned red and he scratched his ears till he bled. I will only be purchasing from pet stores only now.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Amazon’s shipments of this product caused stomach issues
customer_reviews.text: Update: Amazon refunded my money for this purchase and sent my concerns to the necessary parties. I’ve gotten two bags of this in my last three purchases that have caused stomach issues with my dogs. When I purchase this same product from a pet food store it does not cause these issues. I’m not sure why my orders from Amazon have not been fresh but I won’t be able to order it again because I’ve already had to throw away about $100 worth of food and spent $300 at the vet trying to figure out what was causing the stomach issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kj

customer_reviews.title: I had bought this because I couldn't get to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this because I couldn't get to the vet to pick up Royal Canin. My dog has a skin problem exacerbated by food allergies. She tolerates the Natural Balance duck and potato formula just as well as the more expensive Royal Canin and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: gnlmiami

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for our allergy prone dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is allergic to just about every food we have ever tried. This includes, beef, chicken, fish, turkey...when she eats something with an ingredient that she cannot tolerate she gets diarrhea, itchy skin sores, and loses hair. Several other dog foods that had acceptable food contents evidently tasted bad, as we had a hard time getting her to eat them. This product has resolved our issues. The dog eats it without issue, her bowel routine is regular. Amazon makes it easy to reorder. We are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R

customer_reviews.title: My Beagle/Doxie is allergic to the Beef High Protein, but not the regular Venison or Lamb
customer_reviews.text: My Beagle/Doxie mix, Bender, loves NB LID dog food, particularly the Venison. He has allergic reactions to other brands of food, especially any chicken dry food (but for some reason, he is fine with actual chicken). We have gone through testing lots of different kinds of food, as well as home cooked dog food, but always rely on NB for safe kibble. Bender usually eats the Venison or Lamb LID, and when I saw this food, I had high hopes. However, he started having itchy spots all over when eating this food. Maybe it's one of the peas ingredients or flaxseed, I'm not sure. I'm just going to stick with the regular LID Venison and Lamb.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Z

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our chicken-allergic dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was having a lot of ear infections, which the vet said is most likely related to food allergies. Google search confirmed that many dogs when given the same protein (like the chicken in our previous Putin’s ProPlan choice) without switching it up, can become allergic. Turns out most dog feeds, even those that are either flavors like beef or salmon, still have some chicken in them. This one has worked well for us. Our dog transitioned easily, hasn’t had any ear infections since, and hasn’t had any other problems either. Just wish it weren’t so expensive, and we’d be good! (Though j understand why it is)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did they change the ingredients??
customer_reviews.text: Does anyone know if they have changed the ingredients? I've been buying this food for my pups for a couple of years now through amazon subscription. This last order of food has an orange reddish tint to the food. Is this something I should be concerned about?? They are eating it, but I'm not sure if they should be. Any insight would be helpful. Update. I have had this same bag for almost 2 weeks now, and both pups have stoped eating it. One of them is a fatty that will eat almost everything. Went to the local pet store and bought a different flavor but same brand. Color and texture looks normal.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Pursley

customer_reviews.title: Two totally different versions of food! Making my dogs sick.
customer_reviews.text: Both of my dogs have been eating potato and duck from natural balance for 6 months now. We first bought it from the pet store and just started getting it from amazon. The food from amazon is totally different. Smells different, looks different - darker color, and my dogs are eating twice as much of it and they have explosive diarrhea at all hours of the night. The bag expiration isn’t for another year. I expected better from a brand that charges $50 a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brittamarie

customer_reviews.title: Good for food allergies
customer_reviews.text: My pets don't looove this product but they do eat it. I bought it because my Shih Tzu is allergic to a lot of thing and this food has limited ingredients. It is very good because he doesn't cause any reaction on him.
customer_reviews.author: AzulTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: The sweet potato ingredient comes before the venison which tells us ...
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my dog's diet. He got a wound that wouldn't heal. His blood test revealed high fat. I was only giving him this food. My vet shared sometimes the high fat slows down the healing process. My vet is against dog foods containing canola oil. The sweet potato ingredient comes before the venison which tells us it has more sweet potato than meat and the sugar might be too high for some dogs. What works for one may not work for another. It just depends on your dog's needs. So I only write this for one to research for themselves and then decide. I wish I would have known prior.
customer_reviews.author: Sk

customer_reviews.title: Finally a chicken free solution for my allergic dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog started developing weird allergies but has always had an issue with chicken. I’ve had to constantly check the ingredients to keep up with the changes. He can’t eat poultry. I discovered many companies ended up sneaking in chicken eventually to cut costs, usually in the form of fat. I’ve been relieved to find a true “chicken free” food from a company that understood chicken allergies are a big enough problem with dogs to make a food and specifically note it’s completely chicken free. I thank you and my dog Slater thanks you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Made puppy smell like cat pee
customer_reviews.text: We have been trying to find a food that works for our itchy little puppy. We thought that this was the one(!!) as some of her scratching seemed better, however... it's making her skin smell like CAT PEE! If you know the smell, it's literally the worst. I thought I was crazy, but when I googled it I realized it's a thing. This food makes some dogs smell like cat urine. Yay. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moskovitz

customer_reviews.title: my dog does best with the venison or the bison
customer_reviews.text: i have been using this brand of dog food for years now. i started using the venison or the bison, but then have tried other types within this same brand. my dog does best with the venison or the bison. she loves the flavor and i know this is a bit weird to comment on, but her stool is soooo much better on the meat types. i will continue to buy for sure. i was thinking of trying the low cal since she could lose a few pounds, but its better to just cut back on the amount of food i give her and monitor her treats.
customer_reviews.author: sandi danziger

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to everyone
customer_reviews.text: We got our dog 4 years ago at the Humane Society. They told us he had food allergies but didn't know what they were and recommended feeding him this. He still likes it after all these years and he is doing great. We alternate between this formula and the Sweet Potato Bison formula and haven't had any flares for a long time. We weren't so sure about this food at first because it took a few years to clear up the itchy inflamed bald spots, but discovered he was reacting to fish oil. We stopped giving him any fish products and have now been free of skin and ear infections for about 2-3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Helping boxers allergies!
customer_reviews.text: My boxer has severe food allergies was balding and had open sores from scratching had tried multiple no grain combinations including prescription. Nothing was working for this 2 year old boxer. Vet suggested I try fish again but get Natural Balance. Hiccup has been on for about 6 weeks and there has been remarkable improvement. hair growing back and no open sores. scratching and chewing is down 90%. im so optimistic this is all i feed even use small handful for a cookie treat. He is still on 10 mg of pred once a day and hydroxine 3 times a day. will be starting every other day on pred soon. Best he has been since 6 months old!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: A really good no grain, Acceptable carbohydrate and meat not likely to cause allergies
customer_reviews.text: With all the hype these days about no grains, staying away from soy, chickpeas, potatoes it is relatively difficult to find a dog food that has the correct carbohydrates in it that do not cause heart problems. This particular flavor seems to be exactly what the vet orders. It uses a sweet potato for the carbohydrate and then it has one of the few meats that I feed my dog. With all kinds of allergies out there for dogs I stay away from the chicken and fowl, beef. It’s limits my choice to fish, pork, kangaroo. This particular food I can still afford so my dog will be eating it from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper in Millville

customer_reviews.title: Something has changed
customer_reviews.text: I agree with another product review were their dog was going to the bathroom a lot more and my dog is turning his nose up at it. It's even a darker color than it use to be...the tide turned when it's costing a significant amount more now also. Too much waste to me means it's not getting absorbed in his system. My routine is always the same with the same amounts and walking times for multiple years. I'm making a change, in have used this for years and I don't like the changes.
customer_reviews.author: SegaWalker

customer_reviews.title: Faulty food
customer_reviews.text: The company swears they did not change the recipe, but this is completely different from what I would normally get. I have a picture showing what the food should look like, and what arrived. I understand there are more important things going on right now, but the fact that they are not accepting returns of this and I am now out $60 for a bag of food that made my dog sick, is really sad to me.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems to have gone down.
customer_reviews.text: Use to love this product and fed it to my dogs for the last 5 or more years. However, over the last year you could see the formula was changing. Lighter in color, size and texture changes. Now it's very crumbly and doesn't seem good for my dogs anymore. The last bag they didn't want to eat any until they were hungry after not eating for a day or two (I bought a different food and threw the rest of the bag away). Their feces also got browner and mushier the last few months on it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Product has declined terribly - JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: The formula must have changed for both the bison and the venison. Both of my dogs began pooping 6-7 times a day on the new foods, not diarrhea - just a lot of "waste". I changed the dogs to Fromm's and they returned to their previous 11-14 years of 1-2 poops a day. I think Natural Balance must be putting too much filler in their dry foods. I would consider it junk, will no longer buy it, and I was a big fan of Natural Balance for 12 years. I wonder if the company has changed hands and it's now churning out cheap trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa89

customer_reviews.title: This food is great for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: This food is great for our dogs. We have a 50lb Shiba Inu/Australian Cattle Dog mix who is very sensitive. He has allergies and a sensitive stomach. We figured out that he's allergic to poultry. We were using Blue Buffalo Basics Salmon and Sweet Potato Limited Ingredient diet but he was still chewing his paws. His vet recommended trying Natural Balance and this stopped the chewing of his paws. So this is all he gets! We also have a 30lb Boxer/Beagle/Staffordshire Terrier mix who also eats this food. She seems to like it too. They gobble it down when we put it in their bowls and the most exciting part is that the big one doesn't chew himself much anymore!!
customer_reviews.author: ChinersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: second time you send replacement, serial #71945005 not good,SEND me GOOD Another
customer_reviews.text: Terrible....my dog hungry ...you send me again different quality food which i use for my dog all the time i need his original quality bid dark brown dry food you send me small pc light brown dry food, my dog has diarrhea with this because its not same, when i tried return its not eligible, why if its not food as usual i buy,and you know, i need my food for money which i paid not you send second time in plate good food big and dark with nice smell, in box not good contact me, you need to check serial number #71945005 its not good,send me another
customer_reviews.author: tata26

customer_reviews.title: Formula has changed, but Amazon still has wrong description. Made my dog terribly sick.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been eating the Sweet Potato and Fish formula for years without any issues. Last time I ordered, I got Salmon and Sweet Potato instead. The list of principal ingredients has changed, so has the size and shape of the kibble. My dog got terribly sick for a week as soon as I started to feed this new formula. It's grossly irresponsible to change the formula without warning, and for Amazon not to change the description. I note that Chewy has the correct description. From now on I'll be buying my pet food from a store that cares what they sell.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in SF

customer_reviews.title: Yummy for my Dog's Tummy
customer_reviews.text: Well I can't comment on the flavor, but my standard poodle likes this dog food. We tried several others including a raw diet for her, but Natural Balance Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food - Sweet Potato & Fish Formula works the best for her. She's a high energy dog and the food keeps her going strong. Hate to talk poop, but that's been a struggle with the other dog foods we've tried. With Natural Balance, her eliminations are consistent and no longer loose. And her coat looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Bruning

customer_reviews.title: #2 inducer
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food and he is picky. However, I don’t love it. He poops ALL the time now, I take him out four times a day and he goes every time. It is solid which I am told is better than the alternative, but this must have a hugely high fiber content. I am reluctant to switch my sensitive dog to another food yet again but he is going in the house now.
customer_reviews.author: ssstephanie

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this food. He’s happy to eat it at meal time. I’m not going to tell you that he’s a picky eater but he’s definitely more interested in this food than what he ate before (Science Diet). He isn't gazing at the bowl then at me then back at the bowl like something different could magically appear anymore LOL. There isn’t a lot of “dust”/smashed food at the bottom of these bags which is great too. The quality of ingredients is higher than what he was on before so he is eating slightly less which makes the bag last a bit longer :)
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food for dogs with sensitivities and allergies!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog Buster loves this food. Buster has struggled with food from day one.. he has a highly sensitive stomach and has delevoped yeast infections, which turns out is from grains and starch! I have done a lot of research and decided to give this LID food a try. Worked wonders for our dog! Much happier and less itchy, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good Healthy Food
customer_reviews.text: The dog stood by the dog food container for over an hour. I finally gave her a sample even though dinner wasn't for a couple more hours. Because this is a much higher quality dog food than most, it takes less to feed them. The food is dense rather than puffed up to seem like more. Our dog has been on this for 3 years. Our vet recommended it. Given all the other stuff she eats, she probably doesn't need it, but I know what ingredients are in this. Some other brands are very questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Deer HunterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dogs liked it
customer_reviews.text: My one dog has a skin allergy. He is white with some pink pigment. I think he is allergic to grass, but also think it is the chicken, corn, and wheat products that are put in most foods. Even if they say they are beef, salmon, turkey. Look at the ingredients....if the first 3 ingredients have chichen, corn, whey, I stay away from them. Same thing with dog treats....READ THE INGREDIENTS!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M. Lautkin

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food for sensitive tummies!
customer_reviews.text: I was feeding my 3 dogs Blue Buffalo with no problem until I got my 4th pup a husky named Lizzy. She had such bad diarrhea for weeks. The vet tried different meds and treatments and then finally she told me to take her off Blue because it's too rich for some dogs. She suggested a limited ingredient diet of Natural Balance. It helped stop Lizzy's tummy problem and the 3 other dogs like it so this is our dog food now. Ingredients look good and they all eat it so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Quality I trust
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this brand because it is one I trust, but I didn’t read it clearly and was surprised that the kernels were a little larger than my usual order of the “small bites”. My yorkie has no teeth and often swallows his kernels whole, so I try to get small sized kernels. These are small enough for him to eat but big enough to get him to chew a little. He seems to really like these, so I will order these again. Ingredients are simple and I like that this brand allows me to avoid chicken as my dog’s seizures are significantly reduced when we avoid chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Dmp

customer_reviews.title: Natural balance is really an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have only eaten natural balance dog food. They are at least 14 years old. (rescue puppies. I have owned them 12 YEARS. They are healthy and their blood work is perfect. I ran out of natural balance dog food and used another brand of food. The dogs were so so hungry and sooo needed that whole week. I got my new delivery and they are no longer hungry between feedings. And their not needy with with upset stomachs. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND NATURE'S BALANCE.
customer_reviews.author: REAL REVIEW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Ask our dog...she LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves this product. We buy it all the time via Amazon. It's healthy without a bunch of artificial junk in it...no sugar. Why sugar is put in animal food I will never understand. We've bought this product for over 5 years now. Alternate flavors. We buy the big bag, and don't have to get it to the car, into the house. Love ordering this via Amazon. We usually get it within 3 days. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BeverleeC

customer_reviews.title: Food is fine, just need to find what’s best for your dog
customer_reviews.text: This food seemed fine. My dog liked it. I switched to this food bc my dog gets chronic yeast infections on her lower belly and paws. Her rashes got worse on this food, not better, so I switched her to Blue Buffalo limited ingredient grain free salmon and potato. I also add plain yogurt and omega 3s. She gobbles the food and seems to be more comfortable on Blue B. Apple cider rinses seem to help, too. I only buy food in smaller quantities. Seems fresher, regardless of brand.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Name

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: Funny how Amazon asks me about the flavor and scent for the review... smells and tastes great! Haha I refuse to taste this item, but my dogs seem to enjoy the taste, as they eat it daily. It also smells just like dog food, a scent that again my dogs are familiar with and enjoy. But really, I like that I can add this item to my subscribe and save to help cut down on the cost because of course my spoiled dogs get this pricey food. This is the food my vet recommended for allergies, and although I'm not positive it's actually working to prevent allergies they are healthy dogs.
customer_reviews.author: TRW07

customer_reviews.title: Beware of ingredients, not as advertised by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed at Amazon. As you can see in the two pictures I shared, the ingredients in the bag of food are different from those advertised by Amazon. This is a huge deal for dogs with food sensitivities, and one of the main reasons a person would look into “Limited Ingredient Diets”. I’ve been looking for a new food for my dog, and I was looking forward to trying out this formula/brand. However, based on this experience and the ingredients on the bag, it’s not going to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: stench and loose stool
customer_reviews.text: At first we liked this food. After a couple weeks, though, my dogs all started to smell really bad, I couldn't pinpoint for sure what was causing the smell until we got our third bag of this food. It stunk just like the stink coming from the dogs. I fed them some from the third, and the next day the whole house reeked with a musky stench. It made me gag. Plus, they got runny stools. I switched back to the vegetarian version and within a day or so the dogs stopped stinking. It was a really gross experience all around.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Subscribe and (get) Screwed!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT use this item with Subscribe and Save! Every time I review my subscription just days before delivery, the price is competitive and I think everything’s good to go, but the second I get the shipment notice and check the price, it’s gone up by AT LEAST $10 bucks vs when I last checked. What a total SCAM!!
customer_reviews.author: Vivi

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy from this seller!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy from this Amazon seller! I’ve been buying natural balance dog food from Amazon for a year and this bag made my dog so sick. She had to go to the vet and get an injection to make her stop vomiting and she had bloody diarrhea. I know It was The food because we reintroduced the food after she got better and she had diarrhea after one serving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made our puppy sick. Stay away!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and buy the exact same product in stores: our puppy love it. The contents of the bag I bought here looks different and gave our puppy diarrhea and made her vomit. I see now that this is happening to other customers as well. How can this be allowed to happen? NATURAL BALANCE and AMAZON, please take this very seriously. This is affecting the health of our loved ones and is completely unacceptable! Response?
customer_reviews.author: Gail Furrow

customer_reviews.title: My dog love this food and they are finicky eaters
customer_reviews.text: My dog love this food and they are finicky eaters. Trying this food for a couple months to see if this good helps with my Pitbulls skin allergies. Will update in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: saved epileptic dog's life
customer_reviews.text: My little four year old pomeranian started having seizures at about age 2. He was having 20-30 a month! We got him medicated, but the seizures didn't let up. I found a web site of a vet who specializes in managing canine seizures though diet and he recommends a legume/pea free formula. He also recommended this brand (salmon and sweet potato). We switched over immediately and now, two years later, pup has had two seizures in the past 18 months. Their intensity was greatly diminished and the vet says NOT to change this food, and that it saved my dog's life because the medications were not reducing his seizure frequency enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good for Limited Ingredients, Bad for Solid Droppings
customer_reviews.text: We tried this for our medium terrier mix after trying the bison limited ingredient food. It worked just as well in stopping our dog from having allergic reactions to the food she ate (she would itch and get infections in her ears), but it had the unfortunate side effect of making her droppings be very soft, greasy and sometimes not very solid. We believe this is due to the fatty nature of duck. This did not happen when she was on the bison food or the chicken food and it went away after switching back to the other ones. We would recommend their other options over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sensitive digestive systems
customer_reviews.text: My golden has always had a sensitive digestive system since she was a puppy. I tried countless solutions when she was a puppy before landing on this silver bullet. She's now 8 and a year ago I tried some other options just to see if she could now handle anything different. Nope! This continues to be my puppies silver bullet. I wish I could offer her some variety in life but this specific flavor in this brand is what "just works" for her.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality anymore
customer_reviews.text: I think the quality of the food has been affected since this company has been bought out by del monte, which was what I was worried about. The shape and color is different from when I first had bought it and doesnt seem to have the same positive effect on my sensitive, aging shih tzus health and energy either. I dont think it is the same high quality brand as it used to be, just ok now. I encourage you to see for yourself and form your own opinion, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Cat Urine Smell, Google it.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this food because my vet mentioned a Sweet Potato and Fish formula might help my dogs skin. I did not find it helped but then I did not use it long because within a weeks usage, my dog started smelling like cat urine. I thought she rolled in it outside and washed her. Less than a day, it was back. Googled it and many many reports of this food causing dogs skin to smell like cat urine. I can say nothing about it's helpful properties.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jansema

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dogs digestion!
customer_reviews.text: Our buttercup loves sweet potatoes. She’s had a lot of teeth removed since she’s old. But she will gobble this food right up. We still give her fresh cooked beef with rice at home. But she always has a dish of this right next to her water bowl. She chows down on the dry and wet food we make. Big bonus is it has helped her digestive system!! She’s had colitis so this dry food helps her stay regular and she seems really happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Layne G

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and very good ingredients
customer_reviews.text: As my lab gets older I wanted to get her on more nutrition and change up from chicken (which my vet pointed out that the high price grain free “protein” is very much pea based) and my labs very thorough Vet looked through different options this by far was the best of the dried foods. My pup is a really picky eater and she surprisingly liked this very much. More energy and cleaner looking coat within a month as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wagz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent limited ingredients
customer_reviews.text: After finding out that our pug was allergic to several ingredients in most dog food brands, we decided to try this variety of Natural Balance. It was difficult to find something of good quality that met his needs, and this has been wonderful. We noticed an immediate improvement in his skin, and digestion. I also like the that pieces are on the smaller side, as he doesn’t much like chewing, just swallowing whole pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Great for my English Springer Spaniel
customer_reviews.text: My English Springer Spaniel has skin allergies and chronic ear infections. I switched her from Blue Buffalo to this food and I wish I would have done it sooner. She has been on this food for a few months now and her chest is completely clear where she used to chew constantly and had several scabs. She loves it and it works really well for her. If you have a dog with allergies, you definitely need to try this food.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: My dog is allergic to poultry as well as many ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog is allergic to poultry as well as many other foods so I'm grateful for LID. She loves to run so the high protein beef gives her a boost.
customer_reviews.author: Calfinn

customer_reviews.title: Vet suggested
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs has colitis and we were recomended by our vet to purchase this food for him. They believed that his colitis was brought on by an allergy to the food we were feeding him. They must have been correct as he no longer has any issues. The price is the same as the local pet store, but as we live rurally, "local" means 45 minutes away. No problem with the bag during shipping ane the food appears to be the same quality we got from the brick and mortor store. If your dog has a food allergy, sometimes limited ingredients, coupled with a more exotic style meat will help.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: Everything arrived perfectly fine. I feed this food to my two pugs
customer_reviews.text: Everything arrived perfectly fine. I feed this food to my two pugs. This is also the only dog food my brother's picky Maltese will ever beg for. However, I was just informed that the potatoes in this formula is converted into sugar by the dogs' digestive systems, which can aggravate my pugs' ear problems? UPDATE: apparently, the potato thing only applies to regular potatoes, not sweet potatoes? regardless, i noticed my pugs flapping their ears a lot when they were eating this--their ears seemed to be bothering them a lot. I switched food to see if they fared better with food that didn't have potatoes at all.
customer_reviews.author: KJI

customer_reviews.title: Happy Healthy dog thanks to this food
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff and so does our 1 year old Old English Bulldogge girl. She has seasonal allergies which freaked me out so I started searching all sorts of stuff and was overwhelmed by food options. Brands then formulas then flavors!! It's literally exhausting. I friend who has bulldogs recommended Natural Balance because of the dye free to help minimize the staining of the dog's tears. Our girl is white so I gave this a try. She loves it - dry, no canned needed. Her poo is consistent and regular. Her coat is stronger and softer.
customer_reviews.author: Caren1875

customer_reviews.title: Stale , not fresh.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been on this brand of food for over a year and we have always purchased from pets mart, this time around i tried to get it off amazon as a subscription thinking it would be easier, however the food itself was stale and not fresh, upset my dogs stomach,
customer_reviews.author: Ruslana

customer_reviews.title: Not fresh unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time that I’ve received this product looking and smelling like it’s not fresh From amazon. It’s a different color, looks really dry, and doesn’t smell like the food usually does, which is disappointing. I’ll have to keep getting it from chewy I guess if I want it fresh. It’s a great product, and great for my dogs allergies but for the price, I’d like to serve the dogs the food the way it’s intended so they enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry C Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up my doggies skin allergies.
customer_reviews.text: My little doggie has allergies to wheat and other unknown things. My veterinarian recommended this as a last try before putting him on prescription dog food. It has worked wonders. He is a rescue and had lost all the fur on his underside. He was itching constantly on a dog food that I got at a chain pet store that was also supposed to be grain free. My little pug has not only re grown all the fur that was lost he has been able to stop taking prednisone for itching. If I drop a wheat cracker and he gets it he itches for days kicks at his ears. Im so happy with this food.
customer_reviews.author: adobe goddess

customer_reviews.title: Helped with food allergy- great quality food
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering this product for my German Shepherd for several months now, after discovering she has some type of food allergy. She used to eat Ultra Nutro, but had developed a constant itchy rash all over that had her chewing and licking herself constantly. After a few vet visits, we narrowed it down to a diet issue, so I switched her to this formula which contained all different ingredients than her former food. Within a few weeks her rash went away and she is back to normal! Her coat is shiny and she is back to normal. Will continue this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Lani L

customer_reviews.title: sweet potato, pumpkin
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a fiber-sensitive digestive system. This means without a certain amount of fibrous carb source (ie. sweet potato, pumpkin, peas), his poop will turn into mush. After trying several brands, natural balance has been the only one to give consistent consistency to my pup's stool. He's not in love with the food but will eat it if he's hungry so all in all, I think the price performance of this product is spot on, especially for those who have dogs with similar GI condition as my dog.
customer_reviews.author: ACY89

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs like it!
customer_reviews.text: Recently switched from Discontinued Iams Healthy Naturals over to Natural Balance. Gradually integrated HN food over course of 8 days for both dogs. So far they have adjusted well. They eat so flavor must be okay. Both of our dogs have allergy issues so as the spring season is approaching it will be interesting to see if the food continues to agree with them. It's been three weeks. Will update if things change but for the limited ingredients, made in the USA, price and amt of food, this is a win win for us.
customer_reviews.author: Barb H

customer_reviews.title: Love Natural Balance
customer_reviews.text: I have both of my dogs eating the same food. They love it and I love the quality. With my 6 year old dog, I used to change flavors within the same brand, however, this was hard on her stomach (even doing it gradually). So, I am sticking with the chicken and sweet potatoes. She has been eating Natural Balance for over 4 years. Weaned my newest rescue dog off the Science Diet they gave him at the shelter so I don't have to feed 2 different foods.
customer_reviews.author: Lori946

customer_reviews.title: My Yorkie votes “yes” on this food.
customer_reviews.text: My two year old Yorkie likes this but he has never met anything that he doesn’t want to eat. I was previously using Fromm’s Grain free, which smells like chocolate in the bag. 😊. My vet recommended Natural Balance Potato and Duck because of the lower taurine level in the Fromm’s. For now, I’m mixing the two foods as a transition. I know he will eat the Natural Balance straight because he loves an individual pellet as a training treat.
customer_reviews.author: Rileymom

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food. The only thing I wish is if the company would make it a zipped up or make some kind of closure at the top. You have to store it in a container or a big big Ziploc. Most other food bags come with a zipper top or some kind of sealer that you can close the bag easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ifyoulikepinacoladas

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Neither one of my dogs like this food. That being said, I have pit mixes 1yr old and a 2yr old. My little girl (the 1yr old) has been itchy for a couple weeks now. I figured, maybe switching her food would help. Unfortunately this food makes her smell like cat urine all the time now because of how both my dogs play and how their saliva reacts to her chemistry.. No good. Not for us
customer_reviews.author: RavenArndt

customer_reviews.title: Quality healthy food delivery to my front door
customer_reviews.text: Quality flavor is amazing . Delivery person left outside my yard gate and I had to haul it up three wet wooden steps onto a wet patio and haul it inside. The reason why I get it delivered to my house is because I don't want to have to do that. I could just go to Mud Bay store and get this. I have fairly Specific Instructions that they're supposed to put them on my patio. Again product is absolutely fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puggle Approved
customer_reviews.text: My puggle with a grain (and we think chicken) allergy LOVES this food. My vet recommended switching him to this after he started developing some weird scabs on the tips of his ears, hoping that it was a food allergy, and the switch worked! No more bloody scabbed ear tips, and he can't wait to eat his meals every day. Plus it's a unique flavor combo, so not like the treats he gets all the time. He also has a very shiny coat and less frequent bowel movements. Can't recommend this food enough for dogs with allergies to common kibble ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Schneck

customer_reviews.title: Great food for labs!
customer_reviews.text: Well I’ve never tasted it but my dogs love it! I notice a nice healthy coat and they’re happy! One has allergies and one has a sensitive stomach and it works great for both! It’s a couple of dollars cheaper than the Simply Nourish and an equal quality.
customer_reviews.author: HollyMD

customer_reviews.title: Vet says she is healthy!
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old14 # Long Haired Dachshund seems to be thriving on this formula. According to the directions on the package, she should be eating one cup daily however, since she is not an active dog, we feed her only 1/4 cup twice a day for a total of 1/2 cup daily. We chose this formula after she developed serious eczema from another product that was a grain free chicken formula produced by a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen G.

customer_reviews.title: The best type of dog food brand, especially for sensitive stomachs!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly. This dog food changed our lives (mine and my dog's). Gone are the days of margarita mix poops. My dog has a very sensitive stomach and I've tried 2-3 different types of brands to no luck. I thought that it was just my dog and his dumb stomach. No, all other brands are trash. I will only use natural balance from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Yosub

customer_reviews.title: Great food but kinda stinky!
customer_reviews.text: So our dog has a gluten allergy and we love Natural Balance for this. We've been really happy with all the other flavors and we really liked what the sweet potato and fish did for his skin and fur (and he loves the taste). HOWEVER! The food smells! When we open the bin for meals it smells like those little fish flakes you throw in a fish tank. And it gave poor Titus the odor de aquarium all the time! He even had more gas (which ALSO smelled like fish!)! So if smells bother you I'd steer clear, but otherwise we were happy with this food.
customer_reviews.author: Melia Smee

customer_reviews.title: Good food, give it a try!
customer_reviews.text: Our beagle doesn't much care for this food, but we believe that it's healthier than most stuff out there. And our dog stays healthy, and has plenty of energy.
customer_reviews.author: JGM

customer_reviews.title: My 11 year old picky eater loved this at first
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old picky eater loved this at first. Five days later, he wouldn't eat more than a bite or two. I thought I'd entice him with a few nibbles direct from the air tight container, and when I opened it, it was covered in mold.... Less than two weeks after I received it! It's the same container I always use for dog food, and I have never had this problem. I checked the recent reviews, and I see that I'm not the only one with this problem. What a disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My guy has eaten this stuff for 10 years  never gets sick and is healthy..
customer_reviews.text: This is what I feed my Shih Tzu he loves it for years he's healthy ..doesn't upset his stomach like other Foods... and I met the last owner of this company so I trust them.. he did retire and sell so it is a new company but I checked with him and he still gives it the thumbs up and he has three dogs.. I mix it with health extension chunky can food.. the combination is great..
customer_reviews.author: SRR

customer_reviews.title: Dog Smells Like Cat Pee!
customer_reviews.text: Tried Natural Balance for the first time for my dog. She started smelling like car pee. Finally did a web search after tons of baths, washing everything & spraying Nature's Miracle. Turns out this is a common issue with this brand. It's going to be dumped :-/. Cat food seems perfect for the cats but horrid for the dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good meat alternative
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pitbulls who of course have allergies. They love chicken but cannot have it since it makes them very itchy. Instead of spending a significantly more money on prescription food we gave this one a try and if has helped a lot. They don't really have allergies or itchy skin anymore and their coat is so soft and shiny due to this.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fixed a food allergy problem
customer_reviews.text: We where having food allergy issues with our labrabull and even after eleminating things from his diet the food was still causing ear infections and insesent licking of the paws. This cleared it up! Not cheap but not as over priced as some of the rx food options we could have been stuck with. He’s a chow hound so I didn’t think there would be any picky issues but he loves this food so he’s a happy pup with no more food allergies.
customer_reviews.author: The big tuna lv

customer_reviews.title: I mean it is dog food
customer_reviews.text: We started to get this in the mail to make sure that the doggos weren't ever without food, which almost happened because we had a large winter storm and everything was closed and the dogs looked at me with their sad puppy dog eyes. So I got this on repeat and it costs less than at the local store, it comes to our house, and the box provides fun for days (or until recycling comes) for the cats. So really it is a win win win.
customer_reviews.author: Loving the Columbia Gorge

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality- expired kibble
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this dog food is extremely inconsistent. I have this on subscription since it’s one of the few I can find that doesn’t have peas (my golden has pea allergies... I know.) I get some really good quality bags, but most of the time I get very old kibble, that is smaller and dried up and looks very expired. I’ve added photos to show you the same exact brand but two different months.
customer_reviews.author: LKS1989

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but the best for my Aussie!
customer_reviews.text: My Aussie would eat anything but I buy this because he gets an allergy from a food that is not a limited ingredient food. My vet recommended this because he was too frequently urinating from the other quality food I was feeding him. I thought the vet was crazy because my other two Aussies can eat the same food but in 3.5 weeks my Aussie didn't get up 3x a night or shake his head constantly after being started on this food.
customer_reviews.author: Irishbel

customer_reviews.title: My dog will not eat this!
customer_reviews.text: My dog will not eat this. I dont know if its old or spoiled or counterfit product. I usually buy this at the local pet store. If he wont eat it, then something is wrong with it. I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: timetoretire

customer_reviews.title: Answered my prayers
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find this! My dog has such terrible allergies, and I haven't been able to find dry food that only has beef. My girl isn't having a reaction to this, and my life is much easier
customer_reviews.author: Kellyn McClanahan

customer_reviews.title: Goldendoodle Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very fussy Medium Goldendoodle that just loves this food in the Chicken and Sweet Potato. Tried several other brands that she would not take to and made her breath smell but this is what she loves. I alternate between 2 flavors of this brand but the chicken is her favorite. My only complaint is I do think this food is getting really expensive for dog food no matter how good it is!
customer_reviews.author: WhiteLotusOM

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for your dog that need a limited ingredient diet. <3 thank you natural balance.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved this food. It really helped her allergies and after 6 months of issues she had none for 7 years while eating this product. Highly recommend it....cant rate the flavor tho! I loved my dog too...unfortunately we lost her...so I'm donating her open food and returning the unopened.
customer_reviews.author: jewelry gal 1075

customer_reviews.title: Horrible dog food causes bowel issues
customer_reviews.text: My 75lbs Labrador has been having ablsouetly questionable dehydrated, black miniature bowel movements- the size you’d expect to come from Chihuahua rather than a well fed Labrador. It’s food. There was nothing sharp sticking out of the pebbles, and my Labrador will eat it because we feed her a cup of dry food, a banana, and an egg. Her usual twice a day meal always includes an egg and a banana, the only difference was including Natural Balance into the mix which immediately caused this issue. Therefore, the quality of the food is not worth the price, let alone worthy for your own pup.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Great food ... bummed about price increase
customer_reviews.text: Our dog LOVES this food, I love that there are so many flavor options. We have been feeding him this brand since he was a pup (6 years). We have recently changed our dog over to an all raw diet but since we are getting a new puppy soon I think we will be doing a half and half diet of this food with raw food for them. I am so disappointed about the recent price increase and will be going to my local pet stores to purchase the food instead of buying it here, much cheaper. Too bad, it was very convenient to have it delivered to my front door.
customer_reviews.author: McPhee

customer_reviews.title: Changed for the worse
customer_reviews.text: According to one reviewer, this product has been purchased by Purina. Our dog is now vomiting it up. I understand that some of the ingredients are "outsourced." Many reviews denigrate products and suggest a web site that reviews dog food. Don't know who benefits from it, but the reviews are inaccurate and outdated. Merrick, rated five stars, for example, has been purchased by Purina and seems to suffer from the same issues as Natural Balance. Basically, the folks who run the "service," are attempting to get people to subscribe to it. It is very difficult to find trustworthy reviews of dog food, since most of them seem to be controlled by business interests.
customer_reviews.author: Delaware Beaches

customer_reviews.title: Natural balance helps treat itchy skin from allergies
customer_reviews.text: My dog has skin problems that are related to his allergies, and our vet recommended natural balance. This flavor contains the omega 3s found in fish, and sweet potato is also known to be great for their skin. He has stopped itching almost altogether, and his coat has never looked better. This bag is fair for the price, and well worth it considering the savings on taking him to the vet every few months. We will continue to buy, I'm a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Warren

customer_reviews.title: My pupper really likes this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My little guy really likes this stuff. In the past he would get bored of the same old food day in and day out. With this stuff, he is excited at every feeding. Like SUPER excited! So I like that. Also, my dog has an issue with fatty foods and will begin to vomit. This brand is not high in fat which I appreciate and without really knowing my dog does too. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Trying To Be Helpful

customer_reviews.title: Pup LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: I've never ordered dog food online but the ease of Amazon bringing boxes to my door is too good to pass up. I read reviews and this particular food looked like it had great reviews so I bought a 26lb bag. The pup LOVES it! He is the true reviewer. That was what was most important...would the dog eat it or turn up his nose (which he often does). Well the dog loves it, the ingredients look great, and I can now buy dog food through Amazon. I'll look into auto-ship. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Renee

product_meta.title: Natural Balance L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food, Grain Free
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Sweet Potato & Fish| Size:26 Lb. BagFormulated with a limited list of premium protein and carbohydrate sources, this L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets formula is excellent when you are seeking alternative ingredients for your pet. L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Sweet Potato & Fish Dry Dog Formula is a grain-free diet that's also designed to help maintain your dog's digestive health while supporting healthy skin and a shiny coat.
feature_bullets: Contains 1 - 26 Pound Bag of Dry Dog Food
Limited ingredient diet may help avoid certain food sensitivities
Salmon is a high-quality protein that helps maintain strong muscles
Grain free recipe with no artificial flavors or colors

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
